Description: Small redware pyxis and lid, possibly a miniature clibanum; wheel-made and slipped; the rum of the .
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Horatio Herbert Kitchener, Earl Kitchener of Khartoum
Curator's comments: The number 277 pencilled on the base of the pyxis may refer to the original excavation but this is not certain. See D. Bailey, Op. Ath. VI (1965), pp. 5-13 for details of the Hake-Kitchener excavations at Kourion.
Acquisition name: Transferred from: Victoria and Albert Museum
